item.title: Jitter and Phase Noise Principles
item.description: Jitter Considering the jitter from a white noise source on a sinusoidal signal described by: \[ v(t) = A sin( \omega_0 t) + n(t) \] Given the assumption that the amplitude of the signal is much greater than the noise the transition times are only slightly modified. The small signal approximation can be made where: \[ v(t) \approx A \omega_0 t + n(t) \] Find when the signal equals zero at time moment k.
